line_1: Yet close my dull eyes when I see it returning;
line_2: To start from short slumbers and look for the morning —
O'er these waves for ever mourning

line_1: But hang these dull thoughts, I'le fancy him returning.
line_2: He's gone my Dear — and left me here mourning;

line_1: Oh say! what dawn of hope returning,
line_2: To sable night for Phebus mourning,

line_1: No more wild echoes are returning.
line_2: Of bleating lambs, and shepherds mourning;
The frigid blast the shepherd's mourning,

line_1: And weeps every change that it sees on returning.
line_2: For the rose that has faded the eye still keeps mourning,
